ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: I initially was intimidated at the detail in which we evaluated discussion papers. I am a public health student and haven't really critically analyzed laboratory based papers to the level we did in this class.Coming in I felt that this course was a little out of my league, but I really learned that with enough time I could understand the principles and rationale behind a laboratory experiment. It was to the point where I felt as an active participant in the discussions that Immunology PhD students were having. The selected papers were always challenging but I noticed that after spring break these papers were manageable and I wouldn't be stressed about learning lab techniques I never heard of before.The guest lecturers were interesting but the strength of this class were the discussions lead by my peers.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Diane McMahon-Pratt  She was very knowledgeable and presented the material well.

Instructor: Diane McMahon-Pratt  Dr. McMahon-Pratt did a good job selecting speakers. I've had a few courses that had a substantial portion of guest speakers, I would rank this course as having some of the most interesting lectures.I particularly enjoyed Dr. Capello, Dr. Ruddle, the Game Theory lecture, the HPV lecture, and the nanotechnology talk. I believe that Diane had the proper balance of contributing to the lectures when appropriate.The discussions as I stated earlier were really enjoyable. I think that she did a good job facilitating during these sessions. Though it was a lot of work, I wouldn't mind having even more discussions.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Very interesting! I would recommend this class to others.

A very challenging course for EMD students, but if you are willing to put in the time you will learn a great deal about vaccines and develop the valuable skill set to critically analyze scientific papers. I highly recommend the course.
